org.nodex.java.core.file

Class AsyncFile

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.nodex.java.core.file.AsyncFile

  • public class AsyncFile
extends java.lang.Object

    Represents a file on the file-system which can be read from, or written to asynchronously.

    Methods also exist to get a ReadStream or a WriteStream on the file. This allows the data to be pumped to and from other streams, e.g. an HttpClientRequest instance, using the Pump class

    Author:
    Tim Fox

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int BUFFER_SIZE 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Future<java.lang.Void> close()
      Close the file asynchronously.
      Deferred<java.lang.Void> closeDeferred()
      The same as close() but the close does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
      Future<java.lang.Void> flush()
      Flush any writes made to this file to underlying persistent storage.
      Deferred<java.lang.Void> flushDeferred()
      The same as flush() but the flush does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
      ReadStream getReadStream()
      Return a ReadStream instance operating on this AsyncFile.
      WriteStream getWriteStream()
      Return a WriteStream instance operating on this AsyncFile.
      Future<Buffer> read(Buffer buffer, int offset, int position, int length)
      Reads length bytes of data from the file at position position in the file, asynchronously.
      Deferred<Buffer> readDeferred(Buffer buffer, int offset, int position, int length)
      The same as read(org.nodex.java.core.buffer.Buffer, int, int, int) but the read does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
      Future<java.lang.Void> write(Buffer buffer, int position)
      Write a Buffer to the file at position position in the file, asynchronously.
      Deferred<java.lang.Void> writeDeferred(Buffer buffer, int position)
      The same as write(org.nodex.java.core.buffer.Buffer, int) but the write does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.

    • Method Detail

      • closeDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.Void> closeDeferred()
        The same as close() but the close does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • close

        public Future<java.lang.Void> close()
        Close the file asynchronously.

        This method must be called using the same event loop the file was opened from.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of closing the file.

      • writeDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.Void> writeDeferred(Buffer buffer,
                                     int position)
        The same as write(org.nodex.java.core.buffer.Buffer, int) but the write does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • write

        public Future<java.lang.Void> write(Buffer buffer,
                           int position)
        Write a Buffer to the file at position position in the file, asynchronously. If position lies outside of the current size of the file, the file will be enlarged to encompass it.

        When multiple writes are invoked on the same file there are no guarantees as to order in which those writes actually occur.

        This method must be called using the same event loop the file was opened from.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the write.

      • readDeferred

        public Deferred<Buffer> readDeferred(Buffer buffer,
                            int offset,
                            int position,
                            int length)
        The same as read(org.nodex.java.core.buffer.Buffer, int, int, int) but the read does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • read

        public Future<Buffer> read(Buffer buffer,
                  int offset,
                  int position,
                  int length)
        Reads length bytes of data from the file at position position in the file, asynchronously. The read data will be written into the specified Buffer buffer at position offset.

        position + length must lie within the confines of the file.

        When multiple reads are invoked on the same file there are no guarantees as to order in which those reads actually occur.

        This method must be called using the same event loop the file was opened from.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the write.

      • getWriteStream

        public WriteStream getWriteStream()
        Return a WriteStream instance operating on this AsyncFile.

      • getReadStream

        public ReadStream getReadStream()
        Return a ReadStream instance operating on this AsyncFile.

      • flushDeferred

        public Deferred<java.lang.Void> flushDeferred()
        The same as flush() but the flush does not start until the Deferred.execute() method is called on the Deferred instance returned by this method.
        Returns:
        a Deferred representing the as-yet unexecuted action.

      • flush

        public Future<java.lang.Void> flush()
        Flush any writes made to this file to underlying persistent storage.

        If the file was opened with flush set to true then calling this method will have no effect.

        The actual flush will happen asynchronously.

        Returns:
        a Future representing the future result of the write.
